title: What happened after the World Wars? - Quora

response.answer_text: After both wars: The major killing stopped Short economic downturn Refugees trying to return home or find a new home. New power blocs emerged. New (As in independent) Nations emerged. International Organizations formed to prevent the next war by bringing diplomats together to talk, talk, and talk. The organizations were designed to specifically prevent the last war. Both organizations were dreamed up by Progressive US Presidents (Wilson & Roosevelt). Both organizations failed because they were designed to cope with non communication in the League of Nations (Guns of August) or naked aggression UN (Poland 1939). A series of smaller wars. After WW1 Greece and Turkey fought over territory. After WW2 the Greek Civil War was fought. Both wars are commonly seen as ending old power structures and allowing new ones to rise. In the case of WW1 it destroyed the Europe of related Monarchs created at the Congress of Vienna. This allowed Communism in the USSR to come into existence, and its totalitarian partner, Fascism to rise in Germany and Italy. In the Case of WW2 Germany and Japan ceased being major power players on the world stage. The World order coalesced around rival economic/political systems basically barred from direct confrontation by nuclear weapons. So enter the Cold War which lasts until about 1989. Two ways to answer this. Short and to the broad points or write a three volume history.
